translated: The Paṭṭhāna Treatise🔽The Dhamma Section in Pairs (Dhammapaccanīya)

original: Dhammapaccanīya (2), Dukapaṭṭhānapāḷi (2)🔽8.3. Hetusampayuttaduka🔽Nahetusampayuttaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nahetusampayutto dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.
analyzed: dhamma paccanīya duka paṭṭhāna pāḷi  hetu sampayutta duka  na hetu sampayuttam dhammam paṭicca na hetu sampayuttaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: The Pairs Section in Pairs (Dukapaṭṭhānapāḷi)🔽The Pairs Section in Pairs, Cause-Related Conjunctions

original: Nahetusampayuttaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nahetuvippayutto dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.🔽Nahetusampayuttaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nahetusampayutto ca nahetuvippayutto ca dhammā🔽uppajjanti hetupaccayā.🔽Nahetuvippayuttaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nahetuvippayutto dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.
analyzed: na hetu sampayuttam dhammam paṭicca na hetu vippayuttaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā  na hetu sampayuttam dhammam paṭicca na hetu sampayuttaḥ ca na hetu vippayuttaḥ ca dhammā  uppajjanti hetu paccayā  na hetu vippayuttam dhammam paṭicca na hetu vippayuttaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: With an uncaused and unconditioned phenomenon as condition, an uncaused and unconditioned phenomenon arises: with an uncaused and unconditioned phenomenon as condition, a caused and conditioned phenomenon arises: with an uncaused and unconditioned phenomenon as condition, an uncaused and unconditioned phenomenon and a caused and conditioned phenomenon arise:

original: Nahetuvippayuttaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nahetusampayutto dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.🔽Nahetuvippayuttaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nahetusampayutto ca nahetuvippayutto ca dhammā
analyzed: na hetu vippayuttam dhammam paṭicca na hetu sampayuttaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā  na hetu vippayuttam dhammam paṭicca na hetu sampayuttaḥ ca na hetu vippayuttaḥ ca dhammā
translated: With a caused and conditioned phenomenon as condition, a caused and conditioned phenomenon arises: with a caused and conditioned phenomenon as condition, an uncaused and unconditioned phenomenon arises: with a caused and conditioned phenomenon as condition, an uncaused and unconditioned phenomenon and a caused and conditioned phenomenon arise:

With an uncaused and unconditioned phenomenon as condition, a caused and conditioned phenomenon arises: with an uncaused and unconditioned phenomenon as condition, an uncaused and unconditioned phenomenon arises: with an uncaused and unconditioned phenomenon as condition, an uncaused and unconditioned phenomenon and a caused and conditioned phenomenon arise:

original: Nahetusampayuttañca nahetuvippayuttañca dhammaṁ paṭicca nahetusampayutto dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … tīṇi. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na hetu sampayuttam ca na hetu vippayuttam ca dhammam paṭicca na hetu sampayuttaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā tīṇi
translated: With non-root-cause dhamma associated with root-cause as condition there arises a non-root-cause dhamma not associated with root-cause … (three triplets).🔽With root-cause as condition, nine … With object as condition, six … With predominance as condition, five … (In detail.)

original: Hetuyā nava, ārammaṇe cha, adhipatiyā pañca …pe… avigate nava. (Sahajātavārepi …pe… pañhāvārepi sabbattha vitthāretabbaṁ.)
analyzed: hetuyā nava ārammaṇe cha adhipatiyā pañca pe avigate nava sahajāta vāre pi pe pañhā vāre pi sabbattha vitthāretabba
translated: With root-cause as condition, nine … With object as condition, six … With predominance as condition, five … (In detail.)
